sentence.text: The rain was driving down with great force , swamping the dry ground , and within moments her hair was plastered flat against her cheeks .
The square was a sea of flat caps , all tilted upwards towards the notices plastered on the medieval stonework .
Ashen-faced , she was gibbering quietly to herself , her petrol-sodden hair plastered to her head and her dripping gown showing her legs almost to the crotch .
He was a large , barrel-chested man in his early forties , his black hair plastered to his skull with hair cream .
His hair was plastered down with water to his scalp and there was a long scratch across one cheek .
The boy 's hair was plastered with ghee , or clarified butter , as evidence of his achievement .
What Nicholas saw was a sweet-faced young boy , wet hair plastered across his forehead , eyes wide shining with alarm , face flushed with heat or panic .
Within a few days he was a pitiful sight , white-faced with huge puffy red-rimmed eyes , his thin hair plastered to his head with sweat and the comfortable roundness of his baby tummy melted away .
One minute there he was with a few scraps of grey hair plastered across his scalp -- the next he looks like a prizewinner at Cruft 's Dog Show .
He had thinning dyed hair plastered across the top of his head , and his clothes were loud , his hands fleshy .
Pearce was staring wildly at Cardiff now , hair plastered by rain to his head .
Her hair was like dripping rats ' tails , her jeans and sweat-shirt plastered to her body , and she thought she wanted to die .
The theme of many of the leaflets plastered over church walls is the same : ` The police state methods must change . "
Harvey 's face was near , his fair hair plastered close to the skull like golden syrup .
